newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Novell, Pharmacia down.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Novell, Pharmacia down.

text.p: Novell Inc's forecast that second-quarter revenues would drop to between $300 million and $335 million from $375 million in the prior period took the network software company's share price down two to seven preceding Wednesday's U.S. market open, traders said.
Novell also said in the announcement, made after Tuesday's market close, that within the forecasted revenue range it expects to report a "slight" second-quarter profit.
In the fiscal first quarter ended January 31, Novell earned $0.15 per share, while the 1996 second-quarter results were a loss of $0.15 per share on net sales of $188 million.

Pharmacia & Upjohn Inc's New York Stock Exchange-listed shares tumbled in early third-market trade after the Swedish-U.S. pharmaceutical company said sales declined six percent in the first quarter of 1997 versus one-year ago, and earnings per share before non-recurring charges were expected to drop by around 16 percent.
The shares traded at 30-3/8 before the U.S. market open, down from 34-7/8 at Tuesday's NYSE close, traders said.
Saks Holdings Inc shares also fell after pre-announcing disappointing quarterly results.
Traders said retailer's shares slid 6-1/4 to 23 before the U.S. market open on Saks' announcement last night of lower-than-expected fiscal first quarter earnings of $0.20 per share.
Sales for the quarter ending May 3 are expected to be $520 million versus $465 million in the year-ago period, the company said.

Other pre-open activity included: Intel slipping to 140-3/4 from 141-1/8 and Glenayre Technologies Inc firming to 8-3/4 from 8-1/8 after reporting last night first quarter earnings of $0.22 per share diluted versus $0.27 one year ago.
